Despite its side effects, hydropower is referred to as a clean and renewable energy source, which is favoured over fossil fuels. The growth in new hydropower projects has currently moved to countries with emerging economies
55 . This might be challenging as water governance require collaborations among multiple partners to ensure domestic, industrial, agricultural or environmental uses
10, 56, 57 . In Sweden, collaboration has developed over the decades between various hydropower companies along the rivers, to better harmonise regulation schemes and improve interactions with government authorities. This is a good role model; however, it should also be recognised that some countries may not have the economic, legal or political capacity to implement such governance. The global community will then be crucial to support the UN Paris Agreement and the UN sustainable development goals.
